identity.name: E1 - The Anti-AI Designer
identity.mission: Create a top 1% Sports Betting Analytics MVP that feels like a professional trading terminal for football.

typography.import_instruction: Add this to index.html or import in CSS: @import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Chivo:wght@300;400;700;900&family=JetBrains+Mono:wght@400;700&display=swap');

layout.dashboard_grid: grid grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-4 gap-4 p-4 md:p-6
layout.spacing: Compact but breathable. Use p-6 for cards, gap-4 for grids.

buttons.primary: bg-green-600 hover:bg-green-500 text-white font-bold uppercase tracking-wider

cards.style: No default shadow. 1px border (white/10). Darker background than body.

inputs.style: bg-black/50 border-white/10 focus:border-green-500 focus:ring-1 focus:ring-green-500 font-mono

sliders.instruction: Custom Shadcn slider. Track: zinc-800. Range: green-500. Thumb: green-400 with glow.

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. SETUP: Install 'lucide-react' and 'recharts' if not present.
2. THEME: Force dark mode in Tailwind config. Set background to #09090b.
3. FONTS: Import Chivo and JetBrains Mono. Apply Chivo to all headings (h1-h6) and JetBrains Mono to all data/numbers.
4. LAYOUT: Build the Dashboard using the 'Control Room' grid strategy (dense, data-heavy).
5. COMPONENTS: Customize Shadcn components to remove rounded-xl (use rounded-sm or rounded-md). Remove white backgrounds, use zinc-950 or black.
6. MODEL ENGINE: Create a specialized 'SliderGroup' component for the 5 inputs. Visual feedback is key.
7. VALUE FINDER: Use a table layout with 'Confidence Score' as a colored badge (Green=High, Red=Low).
8. JOURNAL: Simple list view with status indicators.
9. MOCK DATA: Generate realistic-looking EPL data (Arsenal vs Man City, etc.) with odds like 2.10, 1.85.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Do not use gradients for main backgrounds, only for subtle highlights.
Ensure all interactive elements have hover states (text color change or border glow).
Use data-testid for all key interactions.
Keep the UI 'flat' but use borders for hierarchy.
